articles.title: The Quest to Finding Chladni Patterns, Part 1: Theory and Algorithms
articles.description: Solve the two-dimensional wave equation via separation of variables and design algorithms to plot Chladni's pattern using the wave equation model.

articles.title: Accelerating Feature Extraction and Image Stitching Algorithm Using Nvidia CUDA
articles.description: Accelerate ORB, feature matching, warping, seam finding, and image composition using C++ OpenCV and CUDA.

articles.title: How to find maxima and minima of an n-th dimensional function
articles.description: Utilizing the Hessian matrix and related numerical methods to find maxima/minima/saddle point.

articles.title: The Quest to Finding Chladni Patterns, Part 2: Codes and Results
articles.description: Plotting a series of Chladni's patterns using the wave equation model.

articles.title: Time Complexity of an Algorithm
articles.description: Theoretical basics about time-complexity of an algorithm, how to measure the time-complexity of a function, examples of algorithms.

articles.title: Light Refraction and A More In-depth Look of Snell's Law
articles.description: Simple idea, complex derivation. Snell's law describe the relationship between the angle of incidence and angle of reflection.

articles.title: The Quest to Finding Chladni Patterns, Part 3: The Biharmonic Wave Equation
articles.description: Explaining Chladni's patterns via the Biharmonic wave equation model. Introducing the Kirchoff-Love plate.

articles.title: Slightly More Interesting Inertia Problems
articles.description: If mass is an object's resistance to change of motion due to force, then moment of inertia is its resistance to rotation due to torque.  Unlike mass, moments of inertia varies based on shapes and axis of rotations. This article explore more about moment of inertia of interesting shapes.

articles.title: Green's Function
articles.description: An in-depth view of how to use Green's functions and their physical meaning.

articles.title: Simulating the Brachistochrone problem
articles.description: The shortest path is not always the fastest path. An introduction to calculus of variation.
